046/** 
047 * A base class for file-based {@link InputFormat}s.
048 * 
049 * <p><code>FileInputFormat</code> is the base class for all file-based 
050 * <code>InputFormat</code>s. This provides a generic implementation of
051 * {@link #getSplits(JobContext)}.
052 * Subclasses of <code>FileInputFormat</code> can also override the 
053 * {@link #isSplitable(JobContext, Path)} method to ensure input-files are
054 * not split-up and are processed as a whole by {@link Mapper}s.
055 */
056@InterfaceAudience.Public
057@InterfaceStability.Stable
058public abstract class FileInputFormat<K, V> extends InputFormat<K, V> {
059  public static final String INPUT_DIR = 
060    "mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.inputdir";
061  public static final String SPLIT_MAXSIZE = 
062    "mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.split.maxsize";
063  public static final String SPLIT_MINSIZE = 
064    "mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.split.minsize";
065  public static final String PATHFILTER_CLASS = 
066    "mapreduce.input.pathFilter.class";
067  public static final String NUM_INPUT_FILES =
068    "mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.numinputfiles";
069  public static final String INPUT_DIR_RECURSIVE =
070    "mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.input.dir.recursive";
071
072  private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(FileInputFormat.class);
073
074  private static final double SPLIT_SLOP = 1.1;   // 10% slop
075  
076  @Deprecated
077  public static enum Counter { 
078    BYTES_READ
079  }
080
081  private static final PathFilter hiddenFileFilter = new PathFilter(){
082      public boolean accept(Path p){
083        String name = p.getName(); 
084        return !name.startsWith("_") && !name.startsWith("."); 
085      }
086    }; 
087
088  /**
089   * Proxy PathFilter that accepts a path only if all filters given in the
090   * constructor do. Used by the listPaths() to apply the built-in
091   * hiddenFileFilter together with a user provided one (if any).
092   */
093  private static class MultiPathFilter implements PathFilter {
094    private List<PathFilter> filters;
095
096    public MultiPathFilter(List<PathFilter> filters) {
097      this.filters = filters;
098    }
099
100    public boolean accept(Path path) {
101      for (PathFilter filter : filters) {
102        if (!filter.accept(path)) {
103          return false;
104        }
105      }
106      return true;
107    }
108  }
109  
110  /**
111   * @param job
112   *          the job to modify
113   * @param inputDirRecursive
114   */
115  public static void setInputDirRecursive(Job job,
116      boolean inputDirRecursive) {
117    job.getConfiguration().setBoolean(INPUT_DIR_RECURSIVE,
118        inputDirRecursive);
119  }
120 
121  /**
122   * @param job
123   *          the job to look at.
124   * @return should the files to be read recursively?
125   */
126  public static boolean getInputDirRecursive(JobContext job) {
127    return job.getConfiguration().getBoolean(INPUT_DIR_RECURSIVE,
128        false);
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Get the lower bound on split size imposed by the format.
133   * @return the number of bytes of the minimal split for this format
134   */
135  protected long getFormatMinSplitSize() {
136    return 1;
137  }
138
139  /**
140   * Is the given filename splitable? Usually, true, but if the file is
141   * stream compressed, it will not be.
142   * 
143   * <code>FileInputFormat</code> implementations can override this and return
144   * <code>false</code> to ensure that individual input files are never split-up
145   * so that {@link Mapper}s process entire files.
146   * 
147   * @param context the job context
148   * @param filename the file name to check
149   * @return is this file splitable?
150   */
151  protected boolean isSplitable(JobContext context, Path filename) {
152    return true;
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Set a PathFilter to be applied to the input paths for the map-reduce job.
157   * @param job the job to modify
158   * @param filter the PathFilter class use for filtering the input paths.
159   */
160  public static void setInputPathFilter(Job job,
161                                        Class<? extends PathFilter> filter) {
162    job.getConfiguration().setClass(PATHFILTER_CLASS, filter, 
163                                    PathFilter.class);
164  }
165
166  /**
167   * Set the minimum input split size
168   * @param job the job to modify
169   * @param size the minimum size
170   */
171  public static void setMinInputSplitSize(Job job,
172                                          long size) {
173    job.getConfiguration().setLong(SPLIT_MINSIZE, size);
174  }
175
176  /**
177   * Get the minimum split size
178   * @param job the job
179   * @return the minimum number of bytes that can be in a split
180   */
181  public static long getMinSplitSize(JobContext job) {
182    return job.getConfiguration().getLong(SPLIT_MINSIZE, 1L);
183  }
184
185  /**
186   * Set the maximum split size
187   * @param job the job to modify
188   * @param size the maximum split size
189   */
190  public static void setMaxInputSplitSize(Job job,
191                                          long size) {
192    job.getConfiguration().setLong(SPLIT_MAXSIZE, size);
193  }
194
195  /**
196   * Get the maximum split size.
197   * @param context the job to look at.
198   * @return the maximum number of bytes a split can include
199   */
200  public static long getMaxSplitSize(JobContext context) {
201    return context.getConfiguration().getLong(SPLIT_MAXSIZE, 
202                                              Long.MAX_VALUE);
203  }
204
205  /**
206   * Get a PathFilter instance of the filter set for the input paths.
207   *
208   * @return the PathFilter instance set for the job, NULL if none has been set.
209   */
210  public static PathFilter getInputPathFilter(JobContext context) {
211    Configuration conf = context.getConfiguration();
212    Class<?> filterClass = conf.getClass(PATHFILTER_CLASS, null,
213        PathFilter.class);
214    return (filterClass != null) ?
215        (PathFilter) ReflectionUtils.newInstance(filterClass, conf) : null;
216  }
217
218  /** List input directories.
219   * Subclasses may override to, e.g., select only files matching a regular
220   * expression. 
221   * 
222   * @param job the job to list input paths for
223   * @return array of FileStatus objects
224   * @throws IOException if zero items.
225   */
226  protected List<FileStatus> listStatus(JobContext job
227                                        ) throws IOException {
228    List<FileStatus> result = new ArrayList<FileStatus>();
229    Path[] dirs = getInputPaths(job);
230    if (dirs.length == 0) {
231      throw new IOException("No input paths specified in job");
232    }
233    
234    // get tokens for all the required FileSystems..
235    TokenCache.obtainTokensForNamenodes(job.getCredentials(), dirs, 
236                                        job.getConfiguration());
237
238    // Whether we need to recursive look into the directory structure
239    boolean recursive = getInputDirRecursive(job);
240    
241    List<IOException> errors = new ArrayList<IOException>();
242    
243    // creates a MultiPathFilter with the hiddenFileFilter and the
244    // user provided one (if any).
245    List<PathFilter> filters = new ArrayList<PathFilter>();
246    filters.add(hiddenFileFilter);
247    PathFilter jobFilter = getInputPathFilter(job);
248    if (jobFilter != null) {
249      filters.add(jobFilter);
250    }
251    PathFilter inputFilter = new MultiPathFilter(filters);
252    
253    for (int i=0; i < dirs.length; ++i) {
254      Path p = dirs[i];
255      FileSystem fs = p.getFileSystem(job.getConfiguration()); 
256      FileStatus[] matches = fs.globStatus(p, inputFilter);
257      if (matches == null) {
258        errors.add(new IOException("Input path does not exist: " + p));
259      } else if (matches.length == 0) {
260        errors.add(new IOException("Input Pattern " + p + " matches 0 files"));
261      } else {
262        for (FileStatus globStat: matches) {
263          if (globStat.isDirectory()) {
264            RemoteIterator<LocatedFileStatus> iter =
265                fs.listLocatedStatus(globStat.getPath());
266            while (iter.hasNext()) {
267              LocatedFileStatus stat = iter.next();
268              if (inputFilter.accept(stat.getPath())) {
269                if (recursive && stat.isDirectory()) {
270                  addInputPathRecursively(result, fs, stat.getPath(),
271                      inputFilter);
272                } else {
273                  result.add(stat);
274                }
275              }
276            }
277          } else {
278            result.add(globStat);
279          }
280        }
281      }
282    }
283
284    if (!errors.isEmpty()) {
285      throw new InvalidInputException(errors);
286    }
287    LOG.info("Total input paths to process : " + result.size()); 
288    return result;
289  }
290  
291  /**
292   * Add files in the input path recursively into the results.
293   * @param result
294   *          The List to store all files.
295   * @param fs
296   *          The FileSystem.
297   * @param path
298   *          The input path.
299   * @param inputFilter
300   *          The input filter that can be used to filter files/dirs. 
301   * @throws IOException
302   */
303  protected void addInputPathRecursively(List<FileStatus> result,
304      FileSystem fs, Path path, PathFilter inputFilter) 
305      throws IOException {
306    RemoteIterator<LocatedFileStatus> iter = fs.listLocatedStatus(path);
307    while (iter.hasNext()) {
308      LocatedFileStatus stat = iter.next();
309      if (inputFilter.accept(stat.getPath())) {
310        if (stat.isDirectory()) {
311          addInputPathRecursively(result, fs, stat.getPath(), inputFilter);
312        } else {
313          result.add(stat);
314        }
315      }
316    }
317  }
318  
319  
320  /**
321   * A factory that makes the split for this class. It can be overridden
322   * by sub-classes to make sub-types
323   */
324  protected FileSplit makeSplit(Path file, long start, long length, 
325                                String[] hosts) {
326    return new FileSplit(file, start, length, hosts);
327  }
328
329  /** 
330   * Generate the list of files and make them into FileSplits.
331   * @param job the job context
332   * @throws IOException
333   */
334  public List<InputSplit> getSplits(JobContext job) throws IOException {
335    long minSize = Math.max(getFormatMinSplitSize(), getMinSplitSize(job));
336    long maxSize = getMaxSplitSize(job);
337
338    // generate splits
339    List<InputSplit> splits = new ArrayList<InputSplit>();
340    List<FileStatus> files = listStatus(job);
341    for (FileStatus file: files) {
342      Path path = file.getPath();
343      long length = file.getLen();
344      if (length != 0) {
345        BlockLocation[] blkLocations;
346        if (file instanceof LocatedFileStatus) {
347          blkLocations = ((LocatedFileStatus) file).getBlockLocations();
348        } else {
349          FileSystem fs = path.getFileSystem(job.getConfiguration());
350          blkLocations = fs.getFileBlockLocations(file, 0, length);
351        }
352        if (isSplitable(job, path)) {
353          long blockSize = file.getBlockSize();
354          long splitSize = computeSplitSize(blockSize, minSize, maxSize);
355
356          long bytesRemaining = length;
357          while (((double) bytesRemaining)/splitSize > SPLIT_SLOP) {
358            int blkIndex = getBlockIndex(blkLocations, length-bytesRemaining);
359            splits.add(makeSplit(path, length-bytesRemaining, splitSize,
360                                     blkLocations[blkIndex].getHosts()));
361            bytesRemaining -= splitSize;
362          }
363
364          if (bytesRemaining != 0) {
365            int blkIndex = getBlockIndex(blkLocations, length-bytesRemaining);
366            splits.add(makeSplit(path, length-bytesRemaining, bytesRemaining,
367                       blkLocations[blkIndex].getHosts()));
368          }
369        } else { // not splitable
370          splits.add(makeSplit(path, 0, length, blkLocations[0].getHosts()));
371        }
372      } else { 
373        //Create empty hosts array for zero length files
374        splits.add(makeSplit(path, 0, length, new String[0]));
375      }
376    }
377    // Save the number of input files for metrics/loadgen
378    job.getConfiguration().setLong(NUM_INPUT_FILES, files.size());
379    LOG.debug("Total # of splits: " + splits.size());
380    return splits;
381  }
382
383  protected long computeSplitSize(long blockSize, long minSize,
384                                  long maxSize) {
385    return Math.max(minSize, Math.min(maxSize, blockSize));
386  }
387
388  protected int getBlockIndex(BlockLocation[] blkLocations, 
389                              long offset) {
390    for (int i = 0 ; i < blkLocations.length; i++) {
391      // is the offset inside this block?
392      if ((blkLocations[i].getOffset() <= offset) &&
393          (offset < blkLocations[i].getOffset() + blkLocations[i].getLength())){
394        return i;
395      }
396    }
397    BlockLocation last = blkLocations[blkLocations.length -1];
398    long fileLength = last.getOffset() + last.getLength() -1;
399    throw new IllegalArgumentException("Offset " + offset + 
400                                       " is outside of file (0.." +
401                                       fileLength + ")");
402  }

404  /**
405   * Sets the given comma separated paths as the list of inputs 
406   * for the map-reduce job.
407   * 
408   * @param job the job
409   * @param commaSeparatedPaths Comma separated paths to be set as 
410   *        the list of inputs for the map-reduce job.
411   */
412  public static void setInputPaths(Job job, 
413                                   String commaSeparatedPaths
414                                   ) throws IOException {
415    setInputPaths(job, StringUtils.stringToPath(
416                        getPathStrings(commaSeparatedPaths)));
417  }
418
419  /**
420   * Add the given comma separated paths to the list of inputs for
421   *  the map-reduce job.
422   * 
423   * @param job The job to modify
424   * @param commaSeparatedPaths Comma separated paths to be added to
425   *        the list of inputs for the map-reduce job.
426   */
427  public static void addInputPaths(Job job, 
428                                   String commaSeparatedPaths
429                                   ) throws IOException {
430    for (String str : getPathStrings(commaSeparatedPaths)) {
431      addInputPath(job, new Path(str));
432    }
433  }
434
435  /**
436   * Set the array of {@link Path}s as the list of inputs
437   * for the map-reduce job.
438   * 
439   * @param job The job to modify 
440   * @param inputPaths the {@link Path}s of the input directories/files 
441   * for the map-reduce job.
442   */ 
443  public static void setInputPaths(Job job, 
444                                   Path... inputPaths) throws IOException {
445    Configuration conf = job.getConfiguration();
446    Path path = inputPaths[0].getFileSystem(conf).makeQualified(inputPaths[0]);
447    StringBuffer str = new StringBuffer(StringUtils.escapeString(path.toString()));
448    for(int i = 1; i < inputPaths.length;i++) {
449      str.append(StringUtils.COMMA_STR);
450      path = inputPaths[i].getFileSystem(conf).makeQualified(inputPaths[i]);
451      str.append(StringUtils.escapeString(path.toString()));
452    }
453    conf.set(INPUT_DIR, str.toString());
454  }
455
456  /**
457   * Add a {@link Path} to the list of inputs for the map-reduce job.
458   * 
459   * @param job The {@link Job} to modify
460   * @param path {@link Path} to be added to the list of inputs for 
461   *            the map-reduce job.
462   */
463  public static void addInputPath(Job job, 
464                                  Path path) throws IOException {
465    Configuration conf = job.getConfiguration();
466    path = path.getFileSystem(conf).makeQualified(path);
467    String dirStr = StringUtils.escapeString(path.toString());
468    String dirs = conf.get(INPUT_DIR);
469    conf.set(INPUT_DIR, dirs == null ? dirStr : dirs + "," + dirStr);
470  }
471  
472  // This method escapes commas in the glob pattern of the given paths.
473  private static String[] getPathStrings(String commaSeparatedPaths) {
474    int length = commaSeparatedPaths.length();
475    int curlyOpen = 0;
476    int pathStart = 0;
477    boolean globPattern = false;
478    List<String> pathStrings = new ArrayList<String>();
479    
480    for (int i=0; i<length; i++) {
481      char ch = commaSeparatedPaths.charAt(i);
482      switch(ch) {
483        case '{' : {
484          curlyOpen++;
485          if (!globPattern) {
486            globPattern = true;
487          }
488          break;
489        }
490        case '}' : {
491          curlyOpen--;
492          if (curlyOpen == 0 && globPattern) {
493            globPattern = false;
494          }
495          break;
496        }
497        case ',' : {
498          if (!globPattern) {
499            pathStrings.add(commaSeparatedPaths.substring(pathStart, i));
500            pathStart = i + 1 ;
501          }
502          break;
503        }
504        default:
505          continue; // nothing special to do for this character
506      }
507    }
508    pathStrings.add(commaSeparatedPaths.substring(pathStart, length));
509    
510    return pathStrings.toArray(new String[0]);
511  }
512  
513  /**
514   * Get the list of input {@link Path}s for the map-reduce job.
515   * 
516   * @param context The job
517   * @return the list of input {@link Path}s for the map-reduce job.
518   */
519  public static Path[] getInputPaths(JobContext context) {
520    String dirs = context.getConfiguration().get(INPUT_DIR, "");
521    String [] list = StringUtils.split(dirs);
522    Path[] result = new Path[list.length];
523    for (int i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
524      result[i] = new Path(StringUtils.unEscapeString(list[i]));
525    }
526    return result;
527  }
